availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas C. Blackwell (Union County, KY, brickmaker)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, brickmaker. Kentucky native. Son of Lucy Blackwell. Married to Virginia E. Taylor Blackwell in Union County on July 22, 1857. Father of Pettie P. Blackwell and Gibson Blackwell. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Household owned an additional eleven enslaved persons in 1850. Brickmaker in Union County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from September 14, 1861 to 1865.
